definition: to continue/to follow after/to go on with/to succeed/to inherit/then/afterwards

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: White writes to his stepson in 1964 from his farm in Maine.
sentences.chinese: 怀特在他缅因的农场里写信给他的继子说。

sentences.english: Few years ago his Navy was "the ugly little stepchild of the Government."
sentences.chinese: 几年前，他的海军还是“政府的又丑又小的继子。”

sentences.english: I asked Delia about the accusations that her stepson had shot the man in North Luangwa.
sentences.chinese: 我向她请教她对继子在北卢安瓜涉嫌杀人指控的看法。

sentences.english: His stepson is still very distant towards him.
sentences.chinese: 他的继子对他仍然很疏远。

sentences.english: Uncle Mike married twice, he has two stepsons.
sentences.chinese: Mike舅舅结过两次婚，他有2个继子。

sentences.english: He is married and has one son and two stepchildren.
sentences.chinese: 他已婚，有一个儿子和两个继子。

sentences.english: In summary, returns management should no longer be the ugly step-child of the supply chain.
sentences.chinese: 总之，退货管理再也不应该是供应链的丑继子。

sentences.english: My step son graduated college last weekend.
sentences.chinese: 我的继子上周末从大学毕业了。

sentences.english: I can't tolerate her wronging his young stepson.
sentences.chinese: 她对他继子的虐待，我无法容忍。

sentences.english: In most cases, step-kids live with their mom and step-dad.
sentences.chinese: 大多数情况下，继子与他们的母亲和继父在一起。
